verses.verse: "Yes,<WH2063> at this my heart<WH3820> trembles,<WH2729> and is moved out<WH5425> of its place.<WH4725>
Hear,<WH8085> oh,<WH8085> hear the noise<WH7267> of his voice,<WH7267> the sound<WH6963> that goes out<WH3318> of his mouth.<WH6310>
He sends<WH3474> it<WH8281> forth under the whole sky,<WH8064> and his lightning<WH216> to the ends<WH3671> of the earth.<WH776>
After<WH310> it a voice<WH6963> roars.<WH7580> He thunders<WH7481> with the voice<WH6963> of his majesty.<WH1347> He doesn't<WH6117> hold back anything when his voice<WH6963> is heard.<WH8085>
God<WH410> thunders<WH7481> marvelously<WH6381> with his voice.<WH6963> He does<WH6213> great things,<WH1419> which we can't<WH3045> comprehend.
For he says<WH559> to the snow,<WH7950> <WH1933> 'Fall on the earth;<WH776>' likewise to the shower<WH4306> of rain,<WH1653> and to the showers<WH4306> of his mighty<WH5797> rain.<WH1653>
He seals up<WH2856> the hand<WH3027> of every man,<WH120> that all men<WH582> whom he has made may know<WH3045> it.<WH4639>
Then the animals<WH2416> take<WH935> cover,<WH695> <WH1119> and remain<WH7931> in their dens.<WH695>
Out of its room<WH2315> comes<WH935> the storm,<WH5492> and cold<WH7135> out of the north.<WH4215>
By the breath<WH5397> of God,<WH410> ice is given,<WH5414> and the breadth<WH7341> of the waters<WH4325> is frozen.<WH4164>
Yes,<WH2959> he loads the thick cloud<WH5645> with moisture.<WH7377> He spreads<WH6327> abroad the cloud<WH5645> of his lightning.<WH216>
It is turned<WH2015> around<WH4524> by his guidance,<WH8458> that they may do<WH6467> whatever he commands<WH6680> them on the surface<WH6440> of the habitable<WH776> world,<WH8398>
Whether it is for correction,<WH7626> or for his land,<WH776> or for loving kindness,<WH2617> that he causes it to come.<WH4672>
"Listen<WH238> to this,<WH347> Job. Stand still,<WH5975> and consider<WH995> the wondrous<WH6381> works of God.<WH410>
Do you know<WH3045> how God<WH433> controls<WH7760> them,<WH216> and causes the lightning of his cloud<WH6051> to shine?<WH3313>
Do you know<WH3045> the workings<WH4657> of the clouds,<WH5645> the wondrous works<WH4652> of him who is perfect<WH8549> in knowledge?<WH1843>
You whose clothing<WH899> is warm,<WH2525> when the earth<WH776> is still<WH8252> by reason of the south wind?<WH1864>
Can you,<WH7554> with him, spread out the sky,<WH7834> which is strong<WH2389> as a cast metal<WH3332> mirror?<WH7209>
Teach<WH3045> us what we shall tell<WH559> him,<WH6186> for we can't make our case by reason<WH6440> of darkness.<WH2822>
Shall it be told<WH5608> him that I would speak?<WH1696> Or should a man<WH376> wish<WH559> that he were swallowed up?<WH1104>
Now men don't<WH7200> see the light<WH216> which is bright<WH925> in the skies,<WH7834> but the wind<WH7307> passes,<WH5674> and clears them.<WH2891>
Out of the north<WH6828> comes<WH857> golden splendor.<WH2091> With God<WH433> is awesome<WH3372> majesty.<WH1935>
We can't<WH4672> reach the Almighty.<WH7706> He is exalted<WH7689> in power.<WH3581> In justice<WH4941> and great<WH7230> righteousness,<WH6666> he will not oppress.<WH6031>
Therefore men<WH582> revere<WH3372> him.<WH7200> He doesn't regard any who are wise<WH2450> of heart.<WH3820>"
